summary: SummaryCreate curls or refresh your blowout fast with the INFINITI PRO CONAIR Rose Gold Thermal Curl Brush. Even heat leaves fine to thick hair with a salon look.
details: DetailsFeaturesCustom heat for every hair type with 4 heat settings up to 400Â°F.Ceramic tech heats up in 30 seconds, maintains a consistent temp, and eliminates hot spots.Dual voltage adapts easily to international travel, and automatic safety shutoff provides worry-free use.Create curls that last with 2-in-1 heated barrel with airflow.BenefitsReduce frizz and boost shine for healthy-looking hair with tourmaline ceramic.IncludesBuilt to last and protected by a limited 3-year warranty.Item 2621711

reviews.headline: Best Thing Ever
reviews.comments: I have been trying several different hair dryer and curling brushes over the last three months.  This is the best product I have found to curl my fine short hair.  Love this brush.

reviews.headline: Maybe for fine hair
reviews.comments:
I bought this on the limb and was very displeased. The tool does not get hot enough and thats at the highest setting of 400. Also, i have long hair and the brush just got tangled in my hair. 
Maybe it will be great if you have fine thin hair.

reviews.headline: does not get hot
reviews.comments:
I was excited to try this profuct at a cheaper price point but you get what you pay for. This product does NOT get hot. When it was at 
"400 degrees" I could grab the barrel with my hand. It gets warm at best. The actual brush itself is decent and sleek design. I would only recommend if you have extremely fine/thin/straight hair. Other than that, you wont get much use out of this.

reviews.headline: Took a chance on a cheaper product and glad I did!
reviews.comments: As others have said, the fan is annoying. That being said, when it was time to replace my $200 GHD Rise brush I opted for this and I am genuinely happier with this product. I have fine wavy hair so being able to adjust the temp down to 285 was huge for me (the GHD is set at 365). I also appreciate that the brush on the conair is bigger which results in faster styling. While I wish it was quiter, ultimately the health of my hair was more important to me than silence.

reviews.headline: Good buy
reviews.comments: The tool works for smoothing out frizz, especially after a blowdry. It can be used to put in curls and is easy to use if you read the manual first. The only reason I'm not giving it a 5 is because I have very long hair and it gets stuck very easily.

reviews.headline: Good buy
reviews.comments: The tool works for smoothing out frizz, especially after a blowdry. It can be used to put in curls and is easy to use if you read the manual first. The only reason I'm not giving it a 5 is because I have very long hair and it gets stuck very easily.

reviews.headline: Not a fan
reviews.comments: did not get the volume or wave I was looking for .. i have another brand and love it much more than this one

reviews.headline: Sucks -_-
reviews.comments: Keeps turning off on its own, very irritating ðŸ˜’

reviews.headline: Not what I expected.
reviews.comments: Nice product, just not for me.  Wanted it for volume, not curl. Didn't work like I had hoped.

reviews.headline: Yes
reviews.comments: I really liked this product.  I'm growing my hair out and I needed a heated brush that would pull the wave out of my hair.  It also has a dryer feature.  As I use this more,  I sure I will  get better at using this product.

reviews.headline: Thick Asian Hair Approved
reviews.comments:
To preface this review, I do have four sections of layers in my straight, thick, shoulder length hair. 

I previously used Revlon and Hot Tools blowout brushes that seemed to be quicker to complete a style. I purchased this hair tool with the idea in mind of having a blowout that gave the effect of having velcro/ hot rollers in a quicker time window. 

I will say that I sectioned my hair, applied heat protectant and brushed the tool mid-length and wrapped the ends around the tool and rolled the brush up imitating a hair roller. I used the middle range temp (230F?) and let my hair sit for 15 seconds. By doing 15 second increments, with a total of 24 sections across three layers, I am able to style my hair in 10-15 minutes. 

I am not giving 5 stars since there is sound on this hair tool. I have since upgraded to a different tool, but if the sound does not bother you, I would recommend this to anyone.

reviews.headline: Love it!!
reviews.comments: Great thermal brush! My hair looks awesome after using it. Highly recommend.

reviews.headline: Good product !
reviews.comments: I like this product, i inteneded this for a blowout look but its kind of kike waves but onlt thing is i wish that thr bristles were more grippy? Id want it to be able to grip more onto my hair but other then that its good, just takes practice

reviews.headline: NOT ENOUGH
reviews.comments: Too noisy. Not enough bristles. Not enough heat. Previously used Hot Tools and Calista -- were great.

reviews.headline: Good beginner thermal brush
reviews.comments:
Like many people, I've seen the Wavytalk ads all over Tiktok but wanted to get a device from a more trusted brand. I happened to stop into Ulta and saw the Infiniti Pro pink ceramic thermal brush on a peg hook, but unfortunately it was not on display - so it was a blind purchase. 

Pros:
- Multi-heat settings for different hair types/thickness. 
- Heats up relatively quick, about 1.5 mins to ~350Â°. 
- Lightweight, good barrel length & thickness. 
- NO SILICONE BRISTLES!! The drybar brush on display in stores has silicone bristles which absolutely grab and snag hair causing damage.
- Easy button control, easy instructions. 
- I had little to no frizz after styling.

Cons:
- The tip at the end for leverage can get quite hot on higher heat settings. 
- I wish the tip was a bit longer for more control/tension for longer hair styling. 

Other thoughts:
- This brush has a fan setting, I played around with it but found no real difference with/without it in style retention. 
- Fan setting is relatively quiet. 
- Button placement, I found my thumb was constantly pressing the power button when rotating, BUT, there are features that prevent accidental heat setting changes. 

Final thoughts: This is a good starter tool, lightweight and simple to use for everyday styling. Ensure you brush hair prior to styling and I recommend heat protection when using hot tools. My hair retained a soft wave and good root volume for a few hours with no hairspray, style retention may vary on different hair types and if product is used for hold. Looking forward to seeing how this brush holds up with daily use!

reviews.headline: Great!
reviews.comments:
Im not sure why this doesn't have more great reviews! Its basically the exact one you're seeing all over TikTok, I see some peiple didnt like the fan I personally love it and its never made my hair frizzy, couldve been the lack of product being used for that person. Also, if read the instructions it'll explain how to turn that off:) 

I also reccomend using the Redkin quick blow out spray with it!

reviews.headline: I definitely recommend this project
reviews.comments: Exactly what I was looking for! I wanted something to give me softer curls that would look more like a blowout. I got nervous looking at previous reviews as one girl couldn't get the fan off but I didn't have that issue and the instructions told me how to turn it off and on. But I'll be practicing more with this tool to be able to get even better at achieving the look I'm going for. It has helped me to watch small tutorials of others using hot brush's on TikTok.

reviews.headline: Not for international travel
reviews.comments: Bought this tool in store with the help of a sales associate. Told her I needed something that was dual voltage for my upcoming trip and she recommended this one. First time I plugged it in at my hotel it shut off, and is now broken. Frustrating because now I'm out the money and have no way of styling my hair on my trip. Althought the tool says 120/240 V the plug itself says 125V which is very misleading.

reviews.headline: decent tool
reviews.comments:
its quick and easy to use on 2b frizzy hair. 

sometimes leaves my hair a tiny bit frizzy and a bit hard to reach the roots but its decent for the price. 

would buy again.

reviews.headline: Great hot tool.
reviews.comments: See my pros on this tool.
